name: Flavour N'abania
description:
'''Chinedu Okoli''' ({{Audio|LL-Q33578 (ibo)-Chinwoke 01-Chinedu Okoli.wav|listen|help=no}}; born 23 November 1983), better known by his stage name '''Flavour N'abania''' or simply '''Flavour''', is a [[Nigerian]] singer and songwriter. He began his musical career as a drummer for a local church. His popular releases include "[[Nwa Baby]] (Ashawo Remix)", "Ada Ada" and "Time to Party." He is currently signed to 2nite Entertainment.

In 2008, he released his [[self-titled]] debut album ''[[N'abania]]''. In 2010, Flavour released his second studio album, ''[[Uplifted]]''. It was supported by the singles "[[Nwa Baby]] (Ashawo Remix)", "Adamma", and "[[Oyi (song)|Oyi Remix]]". The album's success made Flavour one of Africa's most sought out artists. He was booked to perform at numerous concerts and social events following ''Uplifted''{{'}}s release.
